fields.description:
I had a working OAuth setup.
I've revoked all tokens in Bamboo and ended up in a situation when OAuth was no longer working and I was unable to make it work using just "Create Issue" link.
When I accessed the issue list for the plan, I got the Login&Approve link. After going through the login dance, OAuth started working again.

JIRA shows:
{noformat}
/rest/api/latest/issue/createmeta [oauth.serviceprovider.internal.AuthenticatorImpl] Problem encountered authenticating OAuth client for url "http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/issue/createmeta", error was "token_rejected", with parameters "{oauth_problem=token_rejected}"
{noformat}
fields.summary: OAuth broken after token removal

fields.description:
It seems to me that when someone uses (misuses?) Bamboo with LDAP as a user repository the AuditLog feature doesn't play with Hibernate well. One cannot enable/disable plan in such situation (he has to disable audit logs). Hibernate is complaing about finding shared references to a collection of AbstractChain.allStages. It seems like AuditLog interceptor is malfunctioning - logs have:
{noformat}
2012-05-15 18:12:29,874 WARN [qtp1022165816-12] [HibernateObjectsAuditInterceptor] Audit Log Interceptor has been called inside itself. This may be indicative of bigger problems...
{noformat}

----

Steps to reproduce:

1) grab attached export_work.zip
2) start a fresh bamboo 4.0.1 (i.e. remove previous bamboo-homes/8085 folder)
2.1) use 'custom installation' method,
2.2) use default values till last step, where:
3) choose "import existing data" -> export_work.zip
4) bamboo will complain something about import failed - ignore that. Restart Bamboo after finishing importing.
5) login as "admin/admin"
6) go to "test" plan summary page, actions->enable plan
7a) "test" plan is expected to become enabled, instead we observe:
7b) Internal server error:
{noformat}
Stack Trace: 
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateSystemException: Found shared references to a collection: com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.AbstractChain.allStages; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: Found shared references to a collection: com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.AbstractChain.allStages
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: Found shared references to a collection: com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.AbstractChain.allStages
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.updateReachableCollection(SessionImpl.java:2905)
(...)
{noformat} 

----
fields.summary: Can't enable/disable plans when audit logs is turned on and when using LDAP user repository.

fields.description:
This is more complicated than it looks - requires work on build queue etc.

Originally started by this support issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7160

Some discussion:
Anton:
I think we will need to "join" multiple items in the queue if multiple builds are queued at the same time.

Brydie:
We really need a queue for the queue.  To solve lots of other issues as well...
I'm not sure you could get around the checking for changes on Bamboo start up though...

Krystian:
I was pretty sure that build concurrency does not affect the number
queued builds but only number concurrent building builds :)
Am I wrong?

Anton:
I think you are right. What I meant was that we do not want to kick off more builds than we have to. Do we?
So if multiple builds get queued at the same time, you do not want to run a separate build for each of them.
Am I wrong about this?

Brydie:
Yes you are wrong :).  Once something is in the queue we no longer have control over it (the agents can take whatever they want).  So the concurrent limit is based on queued and building.
I believe there are currently some technical/logical limitations which make combining queued items not possible (or at least really hard).  Something to do with locking down the revision keys between jobs and stages and stuff.
(I can't remember specifically, I asked Chai a while ago why we never did this - it was on our backlog at one point - and he gave me a reasonable explanation)

Anton:
Yep, I think that would be a good thing to do if possible :) And that is what I was pushing for.
I am sure we can do it if priority is high enough :) Not saying it is, at the moment.

Chai:
bq. I believe there are currently some technical/logical limitations which make combining queued items not possible (or at least really hard).  Something to do with locking down the revision keys between jobs and stages and stuff.

Trickiness comes when you have lots of Jobs in a Plan. Suddenly you'd have to join each individual Jobs, some of which may have already kicked off on an agent. You'd need to cater for changes to job structure etc. as well. You'd have to decide if you want to "remove" the gobbled up build (leave it as unbuilt) or merge the changes into the Build that you actually will be built.

It's possible, but the logic is a little complicated.

bq. We really need a queue for the queue.  To solve lots of other issues as well...

Yeah... Generally the fact that we use an actual JMS queue for keeping the builds means that it's pretty inflexible.

Although given that we now _store_ the build results before we build, + we allow for those results to be rerun, there's nothing really stopping us from creating a result in a WAITING state and add it to the queue when a free concurrency slot becomes available.
fields.summary: Rework how Triggered build strategy handles commits submitted during a build

fields.description: Otherwise there's no way to move between Job results any more
fields.summary: History widget should show history for the Job result when drilled down

fields.description:
Here are the problems I have with that concept:
- we force plugin implementors to implement change detection. It should be entirely optional. 
- we created special BuildDetectionAction to use that interface. This means that we have duplicated code and that special treatment of plugins 'leaks' through entire build trigger stack. What we should've done is to modify existing BDAs (namely Manual and Continued) to use the plugin and fall back on default behaviour if PlanTrigger is null.

BTW. we should not let to override the code that creates BuildChanges in ContinuedBuildDetection. Plugin or not, those changeset are defined by existing result. Lets keep this that way.
fields.summary: Improve PlanTrigger plugin point

fields.description:
This is correct behaviour, but it's misleading for the user.

TA issue creation initially worked when using admin user on Bamboo and admin on JIRA.
Then, I've created users 'mejira' on JIRA and 'me' on Bamboo and granted both admin rights on Bamboo and JIRA.
Went back to TA configuration, got a login screen for 'mejira' (hey, that's me!), logged in. Everything seems fine, but Bamboo cannot connect to JIRA (neither for issue details retrieval nor creation). The reason is account mismatch.

This is misleading for two reasons:
1. I get asked for the proper account (it's only used to set up trust, but that's not obvious)
2. User has no idea why his requests are rejected.

We should have a better error handling for this if possible.
Also, (again, if possible) in such cases, we should fall back to OAUTH (if it's configured). But probably not to Basic.
fields.summary: Creating issues using Trusted Aplications

HipChat is an Atlassian product now. Makes sense to show we know it's proper name... 

Look at the System Notifications page - that has 3 instances of 'Hipchat'.
fields.summary: HipChat is spelt 'HipChat' - that's an uppercase 'C'

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Disable Global Expiry ({{Admin >> Plans >> Build Expiry}}, mark {{'Disable Global Build Expiry'}}, and click {{'Save'}})
# Run a plan multiple times
# Open some build results ({{Dashboard >> Plan name >> Build result number}}) and add some labels in lowercase, like: {{persist keep donotdelete}}
# Edit the plan, and go to {{Miscellaneous}} tab
# Mark {{'Don't expire builds with certain labels'}}, enter {{PERSIST KEEP DONOTDELETE}} in the {{'Labels to keep'}} field, and click {{'Save'}}
# Go to {{Admin >> Plans >> Build Expiry}}, and force Build Expiry to run using the {{'Run'}} button.
# The build results you entered labels in step 3 above *were deleted*.

If you had entered lowercased labels in step 5 above, the build results you entered labels in step 3 above *wouldn't have been deleted*.

This proves that {{"Labels to keep"}} field is case sensitive.

The workaround is to ensure the labels are always entered in lowercase.
fields.summary: Labels to keep field in plan configuration case sensitiveness problem

fields.description:
Now bamboo merges using fast forward. But out workflow need --no-ff option
it would be good if we can specify merge options in bamboo
fields.summary: Git merge options

fields.description:
Currently we can easily automatically integrate Clover with Bamboo by enabling it on Miscellaneous tab on Job configuration screen with a single click. It would be nice to have an option to fail a build in case when code coverage is lower than certain threshold.

A configuration screen could look like job_miscellaneous_clovercheck.png 
 * Entry field with value from 0 to 100
 * On/off toggle

If toggle is selected, then one additional goal "clover2:check" with a targetPercentage=<value> parameter should be executed.
fields.summary: Add job failure based on coverage threshold for Clover plugin

See screenshots below which compares same behaviour in older Bamboo3.1.4 and the latest version of Bamboo4.0.1

aliase settings in 3.1.4

user details in 3.1.4

aliase settings in 4.0.1

user details in 4.0.1
!userdetailsin401.png!

fields.description:
Should select and show <default> by default.

At the moment if there is only one it shows the name of the Repo... Does this mean that it will always specifically pick that repo? I think it works better if we have a disabled select with <default> if there is only one?

fields.description:
Should be more tabular. It's a little hard to see what's going on at the moment

Kinda like

| Repository | Target dir (optional) | Action |
| <default> | core | (x) |
| JIRA | components/jira | (x) |

rather than the normal UI we have, which is pretty verbose
fields.summary: UI for checkout task

fields.description: User should be able to pick important branches and have them shown on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Show Branches on Dashboard

fields.description: So you don't need to reload the page when you're killing 100 errors
fields.summary: Inline removal of system errors

fields.description:
So if the source repo goes down you don't get 100s of errors.

I think we can group this by the system context so it just appends to the same error count rather than different errors
fields.summary: Group system errors by repository id
Inline script editor hogs all CPU and infinitely expands on Internet Explorer

fields.description: Provide a way for Bamboo to automatically map authors to users in the directory. For example, if Bamboo uses LDAP and the SVN repository uses the same LDAP directory, we should automatically map authors.
fields.summary: Automatically map source repository alias to Bamboo username

fields.description:
Activity streams shows the Job results since that's what's being shown in the Queue next to it (give that you build Jobs on Agents).

After a year of using it, I'm not 100% on that was the right approach and showing when builds are finished would actually have less noise and show more useful information.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should show the Build results not the Job results

fields.description: Sometime you want to focus in on just the one Job and see the history of to see the pattern of failure. There should be a selector on the Plan summary to just see the Job's results
fields.summary: Ability to see a history for a particular Job

fields.description: When you click on a Plan in the nav it should take you to the Repo config
fields.summary: First selected tab for Plan should be repo

fields.description: When you click on a Job in the nav it should take you to the Task config
fields.summary: First selected tab for Job config should be task

fields.description:
If you've created a branch you kinda expect to be redirected to that branch's config. At the moment you get the "Dude, where's my branch?" feeling a bit.

May even make sense if you create multiple (at least you'll be drawn to the fact that the branches section - highlighted) will have multiple items in it
fields.summary: Manual branch creation should redirect to branch iff one branch created

fields.description:
At the moment once you've created an issue from a build result, the issue is linked to the result. 

Finding this issue again is difficult at the moment (you need to know the result that you created it from)

It would be good to have a page that lists all the issues created from Bamboo and their status.
fields.summary: Ability to find JIRA issues created from Bamboo

fields.description: Clicking the "Issues" tab on a build result that references any issues takes an unexpectedly long time to load, even if there's only a single issue referenced.
fields.summary: "Issues" tab on build results loads very slowly

fields.description:
On tardigrade it often takes forever to open the dashboards filter plans list. 
This is particularly annoying if all you want to do is clear the filter.
fields.summary: Filter Plans Dialog too slow

fields.description: We currently just do a blanket check for any required fields and dont let you create issue if you have any we dont show.  However lots of these required fields do actually provide a default value.
fields.summary: Create Issue should not prevent creating issue if required fields have default

fields.description:
Raise a bug with applinks.

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-873
fields.summary: Create 'plus' icon missing on applinks configuration page

fields.description:
During the specification of the build task we can specify something of the nature:

/t:Release /p:BuildVersion="1.0.0.${bamboo.buildNumber}" /p:ProductsToRelease="JIRA;Bamboo;Fisheye"

During execution of the task, Bamboo takes off the quotes around the property value which cause the build to fail because the semicolon in this case are used as property separator and hence the remaining part will be an invalid expression as reproetd in the microsoft KB article at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/xx2ke5d2%28v=vs.80%29.aspx. Here is a sample of the build log:
{noformat}
MSBUILD : error MSB1006: Property is not valid.
{noformat}

If the quotes were not removed, all the three options will be considered as values of the property *ProductsToRelease*
fields.summary: Auto removal of quotes from MSBuild options resulting in errors

fields.description:
Possible to install remote agents today but this could be made easier.

See [Atlassian Answers for more background|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/54715/i-would-like-to-install-another-agent-on-a-machine-that-currently-has-an-agent-installed]
fields.summary: Improve multiple remote agent installation on a single machine

fields.description: The Task should be able to read properties from a properties file (simple key/values) from the file system and use the keys and values as Bamboo variables.
fields.summary: Task to read properties file and turn each key value into a Bamboo variable

fields.description: This plugin is used by a lot of Bamboo customers. It would be good to offer commercial support and improvements.
fields.summary: Support the Bamboo Tomcat tasks plugin
Configure an alternate port for the SCP task

fields.description: Many customers have requested support for the [SCP Task plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-scp-plugin] in Atlassian Labs. We should make this an official plugin since it is used so often.
fields.summary: Support the SCP Task plugin

fields.description:
With the new inline script box, there is a draggable handle in the lower right hand corner to resize the box. However if you click and drag the handle to the right side of the sceen (where the handle actually ends up under the vertical scroll bar), then the website does not adjust for the larger box AND you can not resize the box back down to a smaller size since the vertical scroll is in the way.

This happens with IE and FireFox
fields.summary: Inline Script box Horizontal Stretch does not produce a webpage horizontal scroll bar

fields.description: Have option to merge from a specified branch
fields.summary: Task for merging between mercurial branches

fields.description: Have option to merge from a specified branch
fields.summary: Task for merging between git branches

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) create new plan
2) go to its Plan Configuration -> Miscellaneous tab,
3) turn on (check the checkbox, set some expiry details) the "Build Expiry -> Override global build expiry configuration", save
4) turn it off, save
5b) the "Override global build expiry configuration" checkbox stays ticked
5b) where I'd expect it will be turned off
fields.summary: Can't turn off "Override global build expiry configuration" in plan miscellaneous tab.
Order failing builds up the top on the My Bamboo commits view

fields.description:
* Dashboard -> All Plans tab
* Activity -> Current Activity
* Authors, Reports is collapsed into Reports
* My Bamboo -> My Bamboo tab

Order: My Bamboo, Dashboard, Activity, Reports
fields.summary: Move tabs from Dashboard to links into the header navigation

fields.description: Overriding a subversion repository on a Plan branch forces you to re-enter the credentials. In this case, it should give you the option to use the Plans credentials or specify new credentials.
fields.summary: Overriding a Subversion repository on a Plan branch forces you to re-enter the credentials

fields.description:
The REST interface (how did I miss this before, screenscraping sucks) doesn't list the branches available for plans when requesting all plans on the server, all plans within a project, or the master plan for the branch.  Providing the link to the specific branch does provide a back-reference to the master plan though.

Via the REST interface, how does one programatically discover the branches available?
fields.summary: Branches do not show up in REST listings

fields.description:
The new branch functionality shows great promise.  But, and there's always a but, it doesn't handle plans with multiple source repositories.  

For an example setup, I have code stored in the following svn locations:

/svn/libraries/core/trunk
/svn/libraries/widget-creator/trunk
/svn/applications/magic-8-ball/trunk

To create a clean build of the magic-8-ball application, I need to check out all three in order and build them.  If I want to branch the magic-8-ball application for release and have it depend on specific versions of its libraries, the source directories might be:

/svn/libraries/core/branches/3.14
/svn/libraries/widget-creator/branches/12345
/svn/applications/magic-8-ball/branches/1.2

From a functional perspective, each of the source repositories in a plan needs to be able to have a separate source repository path when building a given branch.  This path for the default build, this other path when building the '1.2' branch etc.

On the UI side when configuring a Bamboo Branch, the current location for specifying a different source repository when building for a branch is partially non-intuitive.  To my mind, especially if Bamboo's concept of Branch builds becomes more central to Bamboo's operation, having the different source repositories for Branches as additional options in the Configuration -> Source Repositories -> Edit Source Repository tab would make more sense.  For Branch (pulldown) use [this] repository information with [x] same password or different password etc.  I really like the idea of not having to retype the same repository password multiple times.
fields.summary: Branching with multiple source repositories

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:
1) create new plan, let's call it P1
2) create second plan, let's call it P2
3) create a new branch for plan P1, as a name use "branch"
4) create a new branch for plan P2, as a name use the same "branch"
5) admin->system->indexing->full_reindex->perform
6a) Error message appears:
{panel:bgColor=#FFCECE}
(-) *Indexing operation failed - errors occurred while indexing.: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Duplicate keys in mappings com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.branch.ChainBranchImpl@b2172046=0 and com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.branch.ChainBranchImpl@38c544dc=0* {panel}
6b) not sure what is the expected behavior... should we allow indexing multiple branches with the same name?

----
stacktrace:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Duplicate keys in mappings com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.branch.ChainBranchImpl@b2172046=0 and com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.branch.ChainBranchImpl@38c544dc=0
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSortedMap.validateEntries(ImmutableSortedMap.java:285)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSortedMap.copyOfInternal(ImmutableSortedMap.java:262)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSortedMap.copyOf(ImmutableSortedMap.java:201)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.index.DefaultBuildResultsIndexer.reindexAll(DefaultBuildResultsIndexer.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.index.ReindexAction.execute(ReindexAction.java:68)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}
----
relevant part (DefaultBuildResultsIndexer.java:71):
{code}
        ImmutableSortedMap<Plan, Long> sortedPlanMap = ImmutableSortedMap.copyOf(planMap, Ordering.natural().onResultOf(Functions.forMap(planMap)).reverse().compound(getPlanNameProviderCaseInsensitiveOrdering()));
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot index multiple branches with the same name (Duplcate keys in mappings com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.branch.ChainBranchImpl)

fields.description: Use the latest Clover 3.1.5 in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Upgrade Clover plugin to use Clover 3.1.5

fields.description:
When building several stages including several jobs, i often haven the problem, that the jobs are executed in the wrong order.
Even defining a number as prefix of the job name doesn't help.

See screenshots:
The jobs should be executed in order of their numbers (1,2,3).
Even the job cloning wizard shows the wrong order (1,3,2).
fields.summary: Wrong execution order of Jobs

fields.description:
In some of our products, we have a very detail guide on the server requirements. We have benchmarked this based on some values and that makes it easy for us to direct users. Examples are:

*JIRA*: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/JIRA+Requirements
*Confluence*: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Server+Hardware+Requirements+Guide

If we can have such guides for Bamboo will be great.
fields.summary: Create a performance benchmark for Bamboo

fields.description:
As reported by customer [here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7183?focusedCommentId=2582398&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2582398].
Also screen accessible after the "Clone existing plan" option is slow.
fields.summary: "Create Plan" response is slow.

fields.description:
Mockup: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Simplification+Ideas#BambooSimplificationIdeas-ArtifactTasks

In scope:
* Artifact storing and retrievals configured as tasks should run when the task is executed

Out of scope:
* Upgrade Tasks to convert between the old artifact sharing and the new tasks
* Removing the old artifact sharing ui
* Instead of having a Task for each artifact you want to retrieve and store, we should provide a way of storing/retrieving multiple artifacts in one task. This is out of scope for this issue, but please keep it in mind.
fields.summary: Move Artifact Sharing to Tasks

fields.description:
I exported my Bamboo 4.0.1 instance to a zipfile to migrate it from HSQL to MySQL.

After re-importing, every plan had two repository entries configured, one named "Default Repository" and one named "Plan Repository". The dataset had been upgraded from Bamboo 1.2.4 to 2.0.6 to 2.6.3 to 2.7.4 to 4.0.1 immediately prior to the export/import. The name "Plan Repository" was created by the data migration. I verified by inspecting the HSQL database from which the export was performed that there was only one repository per plan in existence before the export.
fields.summary: Export/import of data duplicates plan repository definitions

fields.description:
I attempted export / re-import to switch DB type from HSQL to MySQL. Import failed. Logs reveal the cause is invalid characters improperly escaped in the export XML:
{noformat}
2012-05-10 15:31:57,613 WARN [qtp582642819-12] [BambooStAXMappingHelperAbstractImpl] Exception during processing testCaseResultErrors.error #1069
com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxIOException: Invalid character 0x7f, can only be included in xml 1.1 using character entities (at char #3078549, byte #3078764)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.StreamScanner.constructFromIOE(StreamScanner.java:625)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.StreamScanner.loadMore(StreamScanner.java:994)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.StreamScanner.loadMore(StreamScanner.java:1033)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.readCDataSecondary(BasicStreamReader.java:4310)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.readCoalescedText(BasicStreamReader.java:4120)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.getElementText(BasicStreamReader.java:675)
        at org.codehaus.staxmate.in.SMInputCursor.getElemStringValue(SMInputCursor.java:1331)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.tests.TestCaseResultErrorMapper.importProperties(TestCaseResultErrorMapper.java:86)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.tests.TestCaseResultErrorMapper.importProperties(TestCaseResultErrorMapper.java:21)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXMappingHelperAbstractImpl.importXml(BambooStAXMappingHelperAbstractImpl.java:167)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXListImportStrategy.importListItemXml(BambooStAXListImportStrategy.java:268)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXListImportStrategy.access$100(BambooStAXListImportStrategy.java:17)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXListImportStrategy$3.importListItems(BambooStAXListImportStrategy.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXListImportStrategy.importListXml(BambooStAXListImportStrategy.java:235)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.BambooStAXMappingListHelperAbstractImpl.importListXml(BambooStAXMappingListHelperAbstractImpl.java:179)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.tests.TestCaseResultErrorMapper.importData(TestCaseResultErrorMapper.java:143)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.importData(XmlMigrator.java:360)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.importFile(XmlMigrator.java:329)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.loadXmlData(XmlMigrator.java:285)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.importXml(XmlMigrator.java:180)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$FastClassByCGLIB$$b6578fc7.invoke(<generated>)
        at net.sf.cglib.proxy.MethodProxy.invoke(MethodProxy.java:149)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.Cglib2AopProxy$CglibMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(Cglib2AopProxy.java:694)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.Cglib2AopProxy$DynamicAdvisedInterceptor.intercept(Cglib2AopProxy.java:629)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$204e6f8b.importXml(<generated>)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.ImportExportManagerImpl.bambooImport(ImportExportManagerImpl.java:113)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.ImportExportManagerImpl.bambooImport(ImportExportManagerImpl.java:91)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.setup.SetupImportDataAction.execute(SetupImportDataAction.java:53)
........
Caused by: java.io.CharConversionException: Invalid character 0x7f, can only be included in xml 1.1 using character entities (at char #3078549, byte #3078764)
        at com.ctc.wstx.io.BaseReader.reportInvalidXml11(BaseReader.java:222)
        at com.ctc.wstx.io.BambooUTF8Reader.read(BambooUTF8Reader.java:140)
        at com.ctc.wstx.io.ReaderSource.readInto(ReaderSource.java:87)
        at com.ctc.wstx.io.BranchingReaderSource.readInto(BranchingReaderSource.java:57)
        at com.ctc.wstx.sr.StreamScanner.loadMore(StreamScanner.java:988)
{noformat}

The problem XML in question is where binary data was printed in JUnit test output, and that's in a /bamboo/testCaseResultErrors/error/content XML element.

h5. Workaround
# Use {{tail -c +#### fileName|head -c 1024}} to get the section of the file where the offending character is located at. ### being the byte number as reported in the error. Experiment with reducing a few bytes before the offending character to get the ID of the error.
# After getting the ID, manually edit the contents of the error through the database to remove the offending characters:
{code:SQL}UPDATE test_error SET error_content='Removed' WHERE error_id=<ID>; {code}
Replace <ID> with the error ID you found from the text.
# Take the export again and import it into the new instance.
fields.summary: Export can write bad XML that Import chokes on

fields.description: For events such as BuildHungNotification and BuildQueueTimeout etc, the build changes inside the currently building do not have the proper db authors, they have some dummy unlinked authors.  This means you can't look up the user that belongs to that author and hence can't send a notification...
fields.summary: Notifications For non build completed event dont work for committers

fields.description: As an administrator I'd like to hook an ebs volume into bamboo ondemand rather than a snapshot, as I need a consistent state of dependencies between elastic instance restarts. I've hooked a snapshot in as per your documentations however I have builds that rely on each others build. For example plan 1 builds and installs as a plan1.jar via maven. plan2 relys on the existence of plan1.jar. Plan2 is then triggered by plan1 and builds succesfully and the elastic instance shuts down. A developer then checks in code to plan2 and it fails, as the elastic instance has no plan1.jar installed.
fields.summary: Provide functionality for automated EBS snapshot updates

fields.description: To reproduce go to a failed build, then go to the "changes" subtab. Then click a green tick (i.e. a passed build). It will enter a redirect loop.
fields.summary: Redirect loop on changes page
Provide ability to pass/use Bamboo variables in NAnt script

fields.description:
In my plan, the build strategy is "Repository triggers the build when changes are committed".

According to [this document|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO40/Triggering+builds], in this strategy Bamboo *will wait to receive a message* from the source code repository about any code changes in this repository. When Bamboo receives such a message, Bamboo will trigger a build of this plan. But the source code management system must be configured to send this message to Bamboo.

In my case, I *did not* configure any post-commit hooks in the repository associated to the plan.

Even though, when I restart the Bamboo instance, after the startup process ends, Bamboo will wrongly poll the repository for changes. This is on the logs:
{noformat}
jvm 1    | 2012-05-09 11:52:42.487:INFO::Started SslSelectChannelConnector@0.0.0.0:8443
jvm 1    | ****************************************************************
jvm 1    | *                                                              *
jvm 1    | * You can see Bamboo by visiting http://localhost:8085/
jvm 1    | *                                                              *
jvm 1    | ****************************************************************
jvm 1    | 2012-05-09 11:52:44,734 INFO [3-BAM::PlanExec:pool-6-thread-1] [SvnRepository] Collecting changes for 'PROJ-PLAN' on path 'file:///C:/Atlassian/Repos
/SVN' from version 178 to 178
jvm 1    | 2012-05-09 11:52:44,820 INFO [3-BAM::PlanExec:pool-6-thread-1] [ChangeDetectionListenerAction] Change detection found 1 change for plan PROJ-PLAN
jvm 1    | 2012-05-09 11:52:45,032 INFO [3-BAM::PlanExec:pool-6-thread-1] [ChainExecutionManagerImpl] Build PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-4 has been dispatched
...
{noformat}

And a build will be triggered if new commits are found.
fields.summary: Bamboo wrongly polls repository for changes after its startup
Upgrade task 2810 doesn't work on jobs marked for deletion on non-PostgreSQL

fields.description: ViewAgent action slow when there's a lot of data (either in "Offline Remote Agents" or in "Elastic Agent History"). Most probably missing DB index.
fields.summary: ViewAgent action slow when there's a lot of data

fields.description:
this url .../ajax/viewAvailableVariables.action?planKey=EXAMPLE may have variable keys whose value is a global variable. Instead of just displaying the name of the global variable, it should display the value of that variable.

||Key||Value||
|$\{bamboo.bacon\}|variable_bacon|

should become

||Key||Value||
|$\{bamboo.bacon\}|tastyBacon|

or

||Key||Value||Substituted Variable||
|${bamboo.bacon}|tastyBacon|variable_bacon|

or soething like that.
fields.summary: plan pages referencing global variables should display the variable value

fields.description:
I often have a need to view Bamboo configuration, but I need to be an admin to view it. An example is finding out exactly which maven arguments are specified as build parameters.

A permission level that grants people the ability to view configuration but not change it would be great.
fields.summary: New permission level for viewing configuration

fields.description:
I love how system errors are grouped by agent / build plan / etc

I would also like to see system errors grouped by shared repository.

For example, Bitbucket having an outage / maintenance results in 100 system errors that need clearing. This could be reduced to just 1 system error per shared repository
fields.summary: System errors grouped by shared repository

fields.description: To reduce build times, agents should retain a copy of the artifacts produced on the agent until the build ends.
fields.summary: Cache artifacts on remote agents

fields.description: Queued builds should prefer agents that they last ran on to re-use existing checkouts and other local build resource caches (e.g. maven repositories or distcc caches)
fields.summary: Queued builds should prefer agents that they last ran on

fields.description: When selecting source repository aliases, the list should be sorted case insensitively.
fields.summary: Source repository aliases should be sorted case insensitively when selecting
